Dialog.text: Ah - Benson. You're new, aren't you?
Dialog.notes: Says his name as if searching her mind.

Dialog.text: Of course you are. Your shuttle arrived on December third. A transfer from our North office. Before that you worked as an adjunct on various unremarkable grant projects.
None of which entitles you to address me in such a familiar way.
It's Madame Director or Doctor Yu. Choose one.
Now. What do you have for me?
Did you solve the power supply?
What about human subjects with Typhon-based Neuromods?
Good work Dr. Benson. I want to activate the towers myself for the full scale test.
Officer Bhatia. This is Director Yu.
It's not the Typhon - it's Claire Whitten. She's a KASMA spy.
She's been here long enough to have her hooks into everything by now.
You have to track her down. Do not let her get off the base, do you understand?
I can't be distracted by this right now.
Handle it Bhatia.
I'm counting on you.
Your men are being slaughtered. Where are you?
Dialog.notes: Almost an accustion. You were supposed to be on duty - what happened?

Dialog.text: This is Director Riley Yu.
We'll soon begin testing of the new Typhon Towers in the Crater. Our specialists assure me the burst energy is harmless to humans.
Nonetheless, make sure you are behind graded-z shielding when the announcement comes.
I'm pleased to authorize our new skill sharing initiative. If you're selected, it means you have an important ability we'd like to capture and share with your coworkers.
The first participant will be... our veteran pilot, Captain Ramon Delgado, who will be sharing his aviation skills.
Captain Delgado, please report to the Labs for a connectome update. And congratulations.
This is Director Riley Yu. I want to officially welcome our newest arrivals.
I'll be blunt - the moon is a harsh mistress. Your time here at Pytheas is limited. And the longer you're here, the harder things are going to get for you.
But... the rewards are there for those who are able to rise to the occasion.
So... let's get to work.
Following her participation in our new skill sharing initiative, Engineer Angela Wagner has been promoted to Operations Pilot I, effective at the end of this cycle.
Congratulations, Ms. Wagner.
And before that you completed your graduate's work in particle physics at UT of A.
